The online/cloud sync services all require monthly fees, and/or extensive config of oauth server configs, etc. (google drive)

A lot of people apparently use obsidian with git to implement sharing which also gives version control to the knowledge base.

The obsidian-git plugin gives an integrated link to a git repo.  They suggest using a private gitlab repo.  **I could start out with gitlab, and then if this works out, I can move it to a local private git server on my own pc.**  But that would not be on 24/7 like gitlab is.  Gitlab might disappear someday. ^950e91

A quick google search showed that Ubuntu and android have a tool called syncthing that at least one person said worked well with obsidian

https://www.reddit.com/r/ObsidianMD/comments/opjojw/can_i_sync_between_linux_and_android/

https://medium.com/linuxforeveryone/how-to-sync-all-your-stuff-with-syncthing-linux-android-guide-536fe61d68df#id_token=eyJhbGciOiJSUzI1NiIsImtpZCI6Ijk5YmNiMDY5MzQwYTNmMTQ3NDYyNzk0ZGZlZmE3NWU3OTk2MTM2MzQiLCJ0eXAiOiJKV1QifQ..Z6pxI9UJ_-9AQeLkn7dWnoOokqZpl1nVsmEa4gGKTMgJCQ-jvuhzh5MO52hK6Dzpk5yJ6ew0iRjrEC0uJBGMrZajBanSdHbQneLW1_c6faX7KigKCA4vwECE2CJD5hVKtjvPYea92L8SffNL23R8qWvI64wN9RAmEMMR1P_oR5TldY7eXW1yX854evW3ZaDodLlI9szjKyRKgoLVdFg9TZEZNjmE77B820GGXv6OPtqjSAz0-TIbzZnYjS9vuqZbURPGWOseNe11J7mrbWYhWPB_4JVmV1kY5CArJuy3HYkRHMDoZ-LBC34CTU9U-zgYRtud2KbRD3PS_-t7W7-g6w
